channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [BOOKKEEPER-32] Clean up LOG.debug statements
item.description: There are a couple of LOG.debug statements in the client package that are not in an if block under isDebugEnabled(). They are invoked frequently, so they affect performance.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Some of these are pretty egregious: for example, BookieServer is toString'ing binary data in READENTRY (which is never acceptable), and additionally doing it regardless of whether debug logging is enabled.

Ok, correction: only the toString'ing of binary data in BookieServer was actually that bad: moved that one into a trace-level conditional, and had it log hex rather than raw binary data.

More than 95% of statements were being properly wrapped, but in many cases there was wrapping where it was unnecessary (ie, for logging of 0/1/2 zero-cost arguments.)
the patch is quite straightforward and looks good. +1 for the patch. will commit it later.

Integrated in bookkeeper-trunk #711 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/bookkeeper-trunk/711/)
BOOKKEEPER-32: Clean up LOG.debug statements (Stu Hood via sijie) (Revision 1384782)

Result = SUCCESS
sijie :
